title: The singleton degrees of the $\Sigma^0_2$ sets are not dense
authors: Thomas F. Kent, Keng Meng Ng, Andrea Sorbi
abstract:
Answering an open question raised by Cooper, we show that there exist
$\Delta^0_2$ sets $D$ and $E$ such that the singleton degree of $E$ is a
minimal cover of the singleton degree of $D$. This shows that the
$\Sigma^{0}_{2}$ singleton degrees, and the $\Delta^{0}_{2}$ singleton degrees,
are not dense (and consequently the $\Pi^0_2$ $Q$-degrees, and the
$\Delta^{0}_{2}$ $Q$-degrees, are not dense). Moreover $D$ and $E$ can be built
to lie in the same enumeration degree.
